meanings.sent1: The fake designer bag was even phonier than the imitation watch.
meanings.sent2: Her smile seemed phonier than usual, making others question her sincerity.
meanings.sent3: The actor's attempt to cry on cue came off as even phonier than his fake tears.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises sounded phonier than a three-dollar bill.
meanings.sent5: The forged signature on the document was so phonier that it was immediately detected.

meanings.definition: Pretending to be something one is not; insincere.
meanings.sent1: His phonier attempt to fit in with the cool kids only made him seem more out of place.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson's phonier smile didn't fool anyone into buying the overpriced product.
meanings.sent3: The cat's phonier attempt at innocence after knocking over the vase was comically transparent.
meanings.sent4: Her phonier accent slipped through when she got nervous, revealing her true origins.
meanings.sent5: The student's phonier excuse for not doing homework was met with skepticism by the teacher.

meanings.sent1: The singer's phonier performance failed to move the audience like her genuine ones did.
meanings.sent2: His phonier apology rang hollow, lacking any true remorse.
meanings.sent3: The chef's phonier smile couldn't hide the fact that the dish was a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The politician's phonier charm was no match for his opponent's genuine charisma.
meanings.sent5: The friendship felt phonier than a plastic flower, lacking any real connection.
